file_content.text: The Republic says we can't land until they confirm father's clearance!
It's all right, Nadia. Belsavis is their prison; they make the rules.
Belsavis is their top security prison; be grateful they haven't shot at us yet.
So if the Noetikons are right, this is where the Esh-kha, our "sleeping army," was shut away.
For their crimes against other races! Jedi, please, be certain about this.
I'll try to persuade them, but the Esh-kha must decide for themselves.
Nothing is certain.
I'll begin with the Esh-kha who opposed the genocide. Perhaps they can persuade the others.
Some Esh-kha were peaceful.
They join our cause, or they stay locked in stasis. It's their choice.
I'm their only hope.
By these coordinates, the Republic prison is practically on top of the Rakata facility.
Seems awfully hazardous--unless they don't know the Rakata facility is there.
What idiot authorized that? Unless they don't know about the Rakata... or the Esh-kha.
But the Republic does know this planet. Perhaps someone could point us in the right direction.
We need the Esh-kha as soon as possible. Any help would be valuable.
Good idea.
No one mention the Esh-kha.
The Republic might get unreasonable about ancient alien warriors right under their feet.
Let's be discreet.
Oh, finally! Jedi, someone down there wants to talk to you.
Hello? This is Assistant Komi, we--no, they're still securing that block!
We're dealing with a major breakout and rioting. Senate clearance or not, we can't help you.
I'm a Jedi Master, and I'm seeking something left behind on Belsavis, maybe centuries ago.
I'm on a vital mission.
A moment, please. Have you ever heard of the Esh-kha? Or the ancient Rakata?
I seek a forgotten species.
The what? We're a high-tech facility. The only old things here are the vaults.
This is a matter of galactic security. Get me someone who knows about Belsavis's history, now.
I suggest you reconsider.
But we don't really have--are you talking about the vaults?
The prison started out maintaining the old vaults on the surface. When the Empire began blowing doors open, the riots started.
What? Try the secondary code!--I think you need my boss, Commander Geland. He studies those vaults as a hobby.
I appreciate your time; it sounds like anarchy down there.
Thanks for the help.
Let me find Commander Geland for you. He's--oh, blast! We still don't have our locator towers.
Is Commander Geland there with you?
Where is he?
Then why am I talking to you?
In other words, you're no use.
Right now, Commander Geland is--oh, blast! The locator towers are still down.
Those locators track our ID cards, but they shut down after the first power cut. I can't find the commander until they're reset.
And the prisoners around those towers are killing anyone who tries to fix them.
Maybe I can restore some order down there.
Let me help you.
I'm on it.
We'd appreciate it. When you reach the towers, you just flip a switch.
The prisoners won't be a challenge, but I hope you have a technician to fix the towers.
I'm a Jedi, not a mechanic.
The towers are the easy part. Just flip the blue switch and they'll reset.
Once the towers are up, I can find Commander Geland. And we--sorry, got to go. Thank you!
